items.preText: Sijan Bhattarai: "Boult not taking wickets in the first 10 overs of powerplay for 2 games already. Something Nz need to worry or Boult will be back soon? "
items.text: edged! No slip in place, and the ball bounces down to third man. It was a genuine edge too
and now he jumps down the track at the left-arm spinner, but Santner sees him coming and pulls his length back, stalling the shot
speared down flat and fast, Mosaddek tapping it back to the bowler
lobbed up full and wide at 78km/h, and Mahmudullah aims a drive out to the sweeper
nicely bowled, Santner sticking to a tight line and keeping Mosaddek honest with a bit of grip in the surface
items.shortText: Santner to Mosaddek Hossain, no run

items.preText: Rahad: "When was the last boundary?? Bangladesh need to get a move on!" -- Not too long ago, the 37th over. But perhaps Mahmudullah heard you - he's called for a new bat
items.text: and now he makes room, thrashing off the back foot through cover for one
superb fielding from Santner at cover! Mosaddek nailed this drive but Santner leapt to his left to cut it off, cleanly
items.shortText: Ferguson to Mosaddek Hossain, no run

items.text: short and quick at 143km/h, and it's too quick for Mosaddek's pull
items.shortText: Ferguson to Mosaddek Hossain, no run

items.preText: Abhijato: "What's your favorite WC memory, as a fan of the game?" -- Henry Olonga's triple wicket miracle in '99. It's that over, specifically, that turned me on to cricket. And look at me now!
items.text: another bristling delivery from Ferguson, the ball bursting off the track to beat the outside edge of a waft outside off
items.shortText: Ferguson to Mosaddek Hossain, no run

items.text: full, straight and it's dug out down the ground
short and rising outside off, Mahmudullah guiding it down to third man
nudged into space on the leg side, just the one though
another quiet single through cover. Bangladesh needed someone to blast

flapped to cover! Santner really held this one back. The ball was delivered at only 76km/h. Really, really slow. Mahmudullah tried to wait for it, but didn't wait long enough, flashing his stroke in the air and straight to Williamson at cover

dismissal.text: Mahmudullah c Williamson b Santner 20 (52m 41b 0x4 0x6) SR: 48.78

items.preText: I'm reliably informed by ESPNcricinfo's own Mohammad Isam that this was Mahmudullah's slowest innings (min 40 balls faced) in the last three years.
items.text: Saifuddin is forward to drive, finding cover
items.shortText: Santner to Mohammad Saifuddin, no run

items.text: misfield at third man! Saifuddin aimed a late cut down in that region, and it was Henry who set after it. He did the hard work, chasing it down, but then fluffed it at the last moment, letting the ball over the rope
items.shortText: Santner to Mohammad Saifuddin, FOUR runs

items.text: and a little backfoot punch ends the over

items.preText: Abhijato: "Did you hear Henry Olonga's musical performance on a reality show recently? It was pure bliss, and led me to watch his cricketing footage on YouTube. What a legend he is!" -- Yep, that's a pretty handy second string!
items.text: tickled very fine off the legs, down to fine leg, just the one
edged! But short of Latham. It was the slower ball from Ferguson, a legcutter at just 118km/h. Mosaddek got a healthy edge, but it didn't quite carry
items.shortText: Ferguson to Mosaddek Hossain, no run

items.text: and a quicker follow-up, up to 143km/h, the ball chopped down to gully
items.shortText: Ferguson to Mosaddek Hossain, no run

items.text: Mosaddek times his slash down to third man well, but can only place it well enough for a single

items.preText: MAK: "It's really frustrating to see my team not playing fearless cricket today. Seems like they are playing with the fear of losing wicket like the old days. Showing too much respect to kiwi bowling attack " -- to be fair, it's also been a very disciplined effort from New Zealand
items.text: quick and rising off a length at 143km/h, but his shot finds point directly
items.shortText: Ferguson to Mohammad Saifuddin, no run

items.text: a 141km/h yorker is dug out into the leg side, just the single. Excellent death over from Ferguson - just three from it!

items.preText: Santner will continue, into his final over now
items.text: slapped out to deep point, off the back foot

items.preText: Shorif Uddin : "It seems pitch is a bit slow. Santner did well which gives hope to the Bangladeshi spinners especially Shakib and Mehidy. " -- Yep, Bangladesh's spinners could be a handful
items.text: a touch too short, but Mosaddek doesn't try anything fancy, working a single into the leg side
